Laplace transform

Definition

The (unilateral) Laplace transform ℒ\mathcal{L} is defined by ℒ[f(t)](s)≡∫0∞f(t)e−stdt\mathcal{L}[f(t)](s) \equiv \int_0^\infty f(t) e^{-st} dt The inverse of the Laplace transform, i.e. the Bromwich integral, is given by F(t)=12πi∫γ−i∞γ+i∞estf(s)dsF(t) = \frac{1}{2\pi i} \int_{\gamma - i \infty}^{\gamma + i \infty} e^{st} f(s) ds
